subject: Re: [junit] Junit Newbie
msgSnippet: I m not quite sure what your asking but here is some example code which might help: public class MyTestCase extends TestCase { public void testJDBC() throws
messageBody:
I'm not quite sure what your asking but here is some
example code which might help:

public class MyTestCase extends TestCase
{
public void testJDBC() throws Exception
{
Class.forName("oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver");
... //do your jdbc tests here
}
}

If you write your test case without try catch blocks
and simply add the throws Exception on the method line
then what happens is that the JUnit testing framework
catches the exception and reports it as an error
condition (i.e. a failure). If you'd still like to
catch an exception so that you can perform clean up
before the test exits just rethrow the exception after
you clean up code in the catch block.
...
public void testJDBC()
{
...
try
{
connection =
DriverManager.getConnection(jdbcURL);
...
}
catch(Exception e)
{
throw e;
}
finally
{
try{connection.close();}catch(Exception e){}
}
}
